content: sugarloaf shrug description inspired by the toast poncho this simple versatile shrug features a lightweight dense fabric with good balance of drape and loft knitted continuously from the neck down the piece starts with a high neck with a rolled edge the shrug is then shaped first along the shoulders to create a saddle separating the front and back additional shaping is introduced across the yoke and shaped at an increasingly gradual rate to create a domed shape the piece is finished with a section of 1x1 rib measurements of finished piece width at neck ~12 inches ~30 5 cm width at hem ~30 inches ~76 2 cm length from neckline to hem ~18 inches ~45 7 cm gauge 16 sts x 24 row = 4 x 4 inches 10 x 10 cm in stockinette stitch on a 5 mm us8 needle needles circular needles with cables of increasing length i used 8 16 22 and 37 cables while knitting my sample but this can be reduced to 1-2 lengths as preferred for knitting in the round tips of 3 sizes 4 mm us6 4 5 mm us7 and 5 mm us8 materials 250 g of snefnug by camarose 50 g = 122 yards 110 meters techniques used - long tail cast on / german twisted cast on - m1l and m1r increases - italian cast off in the round recipe neck using the long tail or german twisted cast on method cast on 96 sts using a 5 mm us8 / 8 or 16 inch circular needle switch to a 4 mm us6 needle and join to work in the round place a unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round bor knit 3 rounds in stockinette stitch switch to a 4 5 mm us7 needle knit 15 row in stockinette stitch the next row is a foundation row and you will place stitch markers across the row to prepare for yoke shaping proceed as follows knit 18 sts pm knit 12 sts pm knit 36 sts pm knit 12 sts pm knit to bor 18 sts your work is now separated into four sections two saddle sections of 12 sts and the front and back sections of 36 stitches each note that the bor will be the center back of your finished piece switch to a 5mm us8 needle to begin shoulder shaping shoulder shaping from here you ll increase stitches along the shoulders to begin shaping the poncho increase row *k to m m1r sm k to m sm m1l* twice knit to bor 4 sts increased 100 stitches total on the needles when completed correctly there should be a single increase on either side of the front and back sections separated by the 12-stitch saddles repeat the increase row a total of 6 more times for 7 increase row total 28 total stitches increased 124 stitches on the needles the next row is a foundation row for continued shaping across the yoke while increasing
